documents.title: crews put out fire at historical derelict hull building
text: humberside fire and rescue attended a fire started deliberately on the third floor of the lord line building last night .
they used three engines and an aerial platform to put out the fire on the third floor of the lord line building .
steve duffield is from humberside fire and rescue :
author: Victoria Holland
BBC Look North

documents.title: companies paying under national minimum wage are named and shamed
text: companies from our region are on a list released by the government being named and shamed for paying under the national minimum wage .
the owners of kls electrical contracting in goole owed over £ 3,500 to one worker .
pasture wood fisheries in barton-on-humber owed three employees £ 375 and smart cool in hull owed one worker almost £ 300 .
all the workers have now been reimbursed .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: one arrest during beverley ladies day
text: police say there was just one arrest out of more than ten thousand racegoers who attended ladies day in beverley yesterday .
author: BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: scunthorpe untied boss says he has point to prove against old club
text: scunthorpe utd boss graham alexander says he has no personal `` point to prove '' at former club fleetwood this weekend .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: european nationals living in scunthorpe worried about housing post-brexit
text: many european migrants living in the uk are worried about becoming homeless following the recent brexit vote according to a survey by the national landlords association .
the findings are supported by a scunthorpe-based charity , which says it 's been inundated with tenants who worried about the impact of brexit .
here are the findings of the survey :
author: Tim Iredale
Political editor, East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: driver arrested after cyclist taken to hospital with life threatening injuries
text: a 21-year-old scunthorpe man has been arrested on sus of causing serious injury through dangerous driving , following a collision on the a18 near gunness between a blue audi a3 and two cyclists .
one of the cyclists , a 42-year-old local man , was taken to hull royal infirmary with life threatening injuries , where he remains in a stable condition .
the second cyclist was also taken to hull royal infirmary , where he was treated for minor injuries .
the driver of the audi was uninjured .
the 21-year-old arrested in connection with the incident has been released on police bail to a date next month .
author: Jonathan Willis
Local Live

documents.title: watch : hull fc coach speaks ahead of widnes match
text: hull fc coach lee radford says it 's important the black and whites get back to winning ways when they play widnes this evening .
he spoke yesterday to bbc radio humberide 's joshua cook about how his team need to bounce back from their weekend defeat to castleford .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: match preview : widnes vikings v hull fc - kick-off 8pm
text: widnes vikings have made three changes to their squad after their opening super 8s loss to catalans .
rhys hanbury , stefan marsh and chris dea drop out with jordan johnstone , ted chapelhow and ed chamberlain recalled .
hull fc forward dean hadley replaces jordan abdull in the only change to the squad which lost to castleford .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: appeal for witnesses following racially aggravated incident in grimsby
text: independent witnesses are being sought after two men were arrested on sus of affray and racially aggravated criminal damage following an incident in grimsby 's stanley street .
officers were called to the area at around 11.15pm on tuesday 9 august , following reports of men causing criminal damage , making racist comments and threats towards the occupants of a property .
two men , aged 33 and 34 have been arrested in connection with the incident and released on police bail .
author: Jonathan Willis
Local Live

documents.title: twenty sunken wrecks to be removed from river near beverley
text: twenty sunken wrecks can finally be removed from the river hull near beverley .
the environment agency has just issued the permits needed to remove the abandoned boats from the water .
the work had been held up because a protected fish , the lamprey , was known to live in the river .
the east riding of yorkshire council wants to remove the wrecks as it 's believed they are impeding the water flow and increasing the risk of serious flooding .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: listen : residents in elloughton at their 'wits ' end ' over parking issue
text: residents on a private road in east yorkshire have become so frustrated with people using their private street to park that they 've clubbed together to get a parking camera .
people living on hearthill close say a lot of villagers are parking while they nip to the nearby shops , blocking the entrance .
it .
now means that flouting the rules could result in a £ 100 fine .
resident peter says they 're not trying to be mean , they 've just got to their wits ' ends .
author: David Burns
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull 's green port welcomes first vessels
text: newly constructed berths built as part of the green port hull development on alexandra dock in hull have welcomed their first vessels .
the vessels are using the berths to deliver almost 400,000 tonnes of crushed stone from norway , which will be used to surface the siemens wind turbine manufacturing site .

we 're delighted to see this investment become operational , giving life to a project that is already creating jobs and that will make a significant contribution to the regional and national economy . ''
author: Sarah Corker
BBC Look North

documents.title: work to start on updating council services in howden
text: work is due to start on monday , 5 september on a £ 250,000 project to provide a number of council services in the same location at howden .
the scheme will involve refurbishing and remodelling the existing customer service centre in the market town to incorporate the library and the children 's centre .
it is anticipated that the new facility will be completed in early 2017 .
author: Chris Arundel
BBC Radio Humberside

documents.title: hull aquarium remains closed following fire
text: the hull aquarium the deep will remain closed today after a fire broke out yesterday .
it started in an electrical cupboard behind the coral display .
everyone was evacuated safely but they will remain closed today whilst the damage is assessed .
author: Jill Archbold
BBC Look North

documents.title: scunthorpe 's british steel to employ 100 new young recruits
text: british steel have announced they 're to take on 100 young recruits this summer .
aged 16 upwards , around 90 of the apprentices and graduates will join the company 's operations in scunthorpe .
they 'll work on placement schemes and are likely to join the company when they 've completed their training .
author: Sarah Corker
BBC Look North

documents.title: hull city face protests by fans
text: hull city faces rebellion from its own fans as it prepares to return to the premier league this weekend .
despite their promotion many fans are currently unhappy following recent problems which have seen ticket prices rise for some and the club entering the season without a manager or full team .
geoff bielby is chair of hull city supporters trust .
he says they 're planning to take action this weekend .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning and welcome to local live for east yorkshire and the humber on thursday 11 august .
my name 's jonathan and i 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport and travel from across the area throughout the day .
please get in touch and let us know what 's happening where you are , by email , facebook or twitter .
author: Jonathan Willis
Local Live
